intro: Ilex harmsiana, commonly known as the Mexican holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, oval-shaped leaves that are typically dark green on top and lighter underneath. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Ilex harmsiana is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
